title: Strictly Come Dancing 2019, Halloween results: Catherine Tyldesley sent home after dance-off defeat to Mike Bushell
text:
An elimination that felt harsh after a judgely disagreement.

Here are all the talking points and social media reaction from Sunday night's results show…

Catherine Tyldesley left the contest too soon

We couldn’t help feeling sorry for Catherine Tyldesley as she was sent home. The former Coronation Street actress said all along that her goal was to reach the Halloween special but the fact that she’s been outlasted in the contest by inferior dancers - mainly Mike Bushell and Chris Ramsey, who both average more than three points fewer per dance - still leaves a sour taste.

Sure, the cha cha cha simply wasn’t her dance. Catherine struggled with the leg action all week in training and made too many mistakes for the judges to overlook. As a genuine beginner, however, she performed every routine whole-heartedly and was always watchable and hugely likeable.

Catherine’s hoofing highlights were her romantic Movie Week rumba to “Shallow” from A Star Is Born, which appeared to be her breakthrough dance, followed by her "action-packed pink explosion” of a Charleston to Beyoncé’s “Single Ladies”. After this mini purple patch, twice scoring in the 30s, her form dipped over the past fortnight.

Catherine departs the dancefloor three weeks earlier than her second cousin, cricketer Michael Vaughan, who competed in the 2012 series.

Still, she developed great chemistry and an endearing friendship with pro partner Johannes Radebe. In true Strictly spirit, she has also vowed to keeeeeeeeep dancing. Chin up, chuck.
description: An elimination that felt harsh after a judgely disagreement.
